names.english: acknowledged decoction for nourishing the stomach
names.commonEnglish: Acknowledged Decoction for Nourishing the Stomach

actions: Nourishes Stomach Yin, generates fluids and clears Heat.
Invigorates and cools the Blood, dispels Blood Stasis. clears Heat, soothes irritability and reduces abscesses.
Promotes urination, leaches out Dampness, strengthens the Spleen and harmonizes the Middle Jiao.
Harmonizes the Stomach, clears Stomach Heat and descends Stomach Qi.
With Zhi Ban Xia, alleviates nausea and calms the Stomach.
Nourishes Stomach and Lung Yin, clears Heat, generates fluids, enriches Kidney Yin and reduces Heat from Deficiency.
Transforms turbid Dampness, harmonizes the Middle Jiao, awakens the Spleen promotes the movement of Qi and Blood, reduces swelling and alleviates sores.
Clears Heat, transforms Hot Phlegm, clears Heat, stops vomiting, cools the Blood and stops bleeding.

With Shi Hu, harmonizes the Stomach by descending Qi and replenishing Yin Fluids to treat hunger with no desire to eat with recurrent nausea, vomiting or dry heaves, thirst and dry mouth due to Stomach Yin Deficiency.
Dries Dampness, transforms Phlegm, descends Rebellious Qi, stops vomiting, harmonizes the Stomach, dissipates nodules and reduces Stagnation.
With Fu Ling, expels Phlegm and stops nausea and vomiting, hiccups, coughs with clear, profuse Phlegm and loose and watery stools.
Clears Heat, relieves Fire toxicity, moderates and harmonizes the harsh properties of other herbs and guides the herbs to all twelve channels

symptoms: Incessant, dull pain with a cutting sensation in the Stomach
The tumor is firm and irregular
Famished but with no desire to eat
